lead_paragraph: China’s Liu Xiang won the 110-meter hurdles yesterday at the Athletissima Grand Prix in Lausanne, Switzerland, running the season’s third-best time despite an unseasonably cold temperature of 52 degrees. Liu, the world-record holder, won in 13.01 seconds. The American Brad Walker set a meet record in the pole vault with a jump of 19 feet 4 ¾ inches.
